pages.text:
Annual membership is $1,000, with a 50% discount for women who are 40 or younger. Memberships can be paid by check (payable to MartinArts, WSA in memo line), credit card, or gifts of stock, and all contributions are tax deductible. Plans for monthly and quarterly installments are accepted.
Members review and rate all grant applications based on several criteria, including merit and value to the community, to assure the best investments are made with the funds. Regular meetings encourage camaraderie and fellowship among members while also introducing members to grant recipients.
Printable Membership Form Option (Click to Download)
If you'd rather pay your membership with a check or stock donation, please print this membership form and send or deliver it to MartinArts. Please make your check payable to the Arts Foundation for Martin County, with "WSA" in the MEMO line. If you'd like to pay by quarterly or semi-annual installments, indicate that preference on this form.
To make a stock donation, contact the MartinArts office to get the information your broker will need to make the stock transfer.
Online Membership Payment Option
Please complete the form below to join Women Supporting the Arts or to renew your membership. You can pay your membership dues at once or in monthly installments. You must select the amount (Annual or Monthly Payments) in the check box and confirm the monthly commitment at the end of the form if you are choosing to pay in monthly installments.

80 Southeast Ocean Blvd.
Stuart, Florida 34994
Tel: 772-287-6676
Directions to MartinArts, located in the historic Martin County Court House Cultural Center
From 1-95 in Palm City, take Martin Downs Blvd. to Kanner Hwy. Turn left on Kanner Hwy. (Colorado Ave.) and follow straight to Confusion Corner. Turn right onto East Ocean Boulevard. The Cultural Center building is immediately on the right past the Gazebo.
From I-95 Stuart/Indiantown exit, follow Kanner Hwy east. It becomes Colorado Ave. Follow straight to Confusion Corner. Turn right onto East Ocean Boulevard. The Cultural Center building is immediately on the right past the Gazebo.
Gallery Hours
: Tuesday, 10AM–6PM | Wednesday–Saturday, 10AM–4PM. Except holidays and interim periods between exhibitions.
Office Hours
: Monday–Friday, 9AM–5PM (unless otherwise posted.)
For more information please fill in the form below. Thank you.

Personal Memberships
We believe that art has the power to inspire, connect, and transform. Join us today, and let your journey through the arts begin!
All memberships $150+ now include benefits from the
North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM),
with exclusive access to over 1,300 incredible venues, including museums, art galleries, botanical gardens, children's museums, and more. Whether you're a long-time supporter or new to the fold, there's never been a better time to join and enjoy the arts as a MartinArts member!
To view a list of participating NARM Institutions, click
here
.
Enthusiast | $65 / Year
Subscription to MartinArts Magazine and Monthly E-Newsletter
Invitations to Court House Cultural Center Gallery Events and Annual Meeting
One complimentary General Admission ticket to ArtsFest
One reserved seat for each Sunset Concert (with pre-registration)
Advocate + NARM | $150 / Year
Subscription to MartinArts Magazine and Monthly E-Newsletter
Invitations to Court House Cultural Center Gallery Events and Annual Meeting
Two complimentary General Admission tickets to ArtsFest
Two reserved seats for each Sunset Concert (with pre-registration)
Exclusive NARM (North American Reciprocal Museum) benefits with access to over 1,000 museums, art galleries, botanical museums, children’s museum, and more
Patron + NARM | $300 / Year
Subscription to MartinArts Magazine and Monthly E-Newsletter
Invitations to Court House Cultural Center Gallery Events and Annual Meeting plus Special Exhibiton previews
Four complimentary General Admission tickets to ArtsFest
Two reserved seats for each Sunset Concert (with pre-registration)
Exclusive NARM (North American Reciprocal Museum) benefits with access to over 1,000 museums, art galleries, botanical museums, children’s museum, and more
Benefactor + NARM | $540 / Year
Subscription to MartinArts Magazine and Monthly E-Newsletter
Invitations to Court House Cultural Center Gallery Events and Annual Meeting plus Special Exhibiton previews
Six complimentary General Admission tickets to ArtsFest
Four reserved seats for each Sunset Concert (with pre-registration)
Exclusive NARM (North American Reciprocal Museum) benefits with access to over 1,000 museums, art galleries, botanical museums, children’s museum, and more

Women Supporting the Arts works to build a community of local philanthropists who inspire, educate, and encourage a strong arts and cultural environment in Martin County.
To provide grants for arts enhancement programs, projects, scholarships, and internships to adults and children of all cultural and economic backgrounds in Martin County.
To educate women about the arts and cultural needs of the community and provide learning opportunities for philanthropy.
To develop friendships, support and networking opportunities by working for a common goal.
Women Supporting the Arts was born in 2004, when there were no local funding sources to support the county’s artists and cultural projects. MartinArts embraced the vision of a women's giving circle and has continued to provide support through its 501(c)3 umbrella and administrative services. In a community where the annual economic impact of the arts is more than 31 million, our grants fill an important gap.
WSA makes modest grants to individual artists; students; local arts organizations, civic groups, and nonprofits; and occasional government agency programs. Grant amounts average about $1,400, and the range (to date) goes from a low of $150 to a high of $9,000. All decisions about grants and allocations are made by group consensus.
Join Women Supporting the Arts
Learn more about our Grant Process

As a private nonprofit arts agency, membership is the backbone of MartinArts, providing us with valuable support that allows us to fulfill our mission of inspiring participation and passion for the arts in Martin County 365 Days a Year.
As a MartinArts member, you’re joining a community that celebrates the power of the arts and how they contribute to a vibrant quality of life. Whether you are a creative professional or an arts enthusiast, our membership provides individuals, local organizations and businesses a range of benefits for enjoying and promoting the arts in our area like a subscription to
MartinArts Magazine
, tickets to our annual ArtsFest celebration and member discounts on events.
We've also partnered with the
North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM)
which gives you exclusive access to over 1,300 incredible venues, including museums, art galleries, botanical gardens, children's museums, and more!
Every gift of membership is meaningful and makes a tremendous difference! We thank you for your dedication to growing the arts together.
Artist Memberships
For creative professionals within the visual, performing, literary and culinary arts.
Personal Memberships
For patrons of the arts who want to join us in or mission of inspiring participation and passion for the arts.
Business/ Organizational Partners for the Arts
For local organizations and businesses, large and small, who believe that investing in the arts not only strengthens our economy but also improves the health and well-being of its people.
NARM Benefits
We've partnered with the North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM) which means new perks for our valued members!

Since 2004, Women Supporting the Arts has provided nearly $500,000 in grants to artists and arts-related programs. Here’s what you need to know about applying.
Application period opens
August 1, 2025
Information session for potential applicants
August 20, 2025
Application due date
September 24, 2025, 5 p.m.
September 24, 2025, 5 p.m. WSA member review period
October 21 through November 14, 2025
WSA award payments
January 2026
Grantee progress report due
August
Grant funding period
All of 2026
Apply for a WSA Grant
Follow this link for our application and required budget form.
Applications are due September 24, 2025 at 5PM.
All applications must be submitted via the online platform. No other method will be considered.
Submit Your Grant Report
Use this link to get to the online form for submitting your partial or final grant report. A report is due every August on the status of your project, regardless of its status.

Celebrating over 20 YEARS of honoring outstanding artistic, voluntary, and philanthropic achievement in support of the arts in our community.
Since 2003, the MartinArts Awards have been a signature event of MartinArts honoring outstanding artistic, voluntary, and philanthropic achievement in Martin County.
Over $25,000 in scholarships have been awarded to student recipients of a MartinArts Award
The awards showcase draws more than 300 attendees annually, and features current nominees and past award recipients
Honorary awards represent a legacy of commitment to areas such as leadership, arts education, philanthropy and lifetime achievement
The arts enhance personal well-being and unite communities. Sponsorships for the MartinArts Awards play a vital role in funding our ongoing initiatives to inspire participation and passion for the arts. MartinArts programs cultivate a vibrant arts community that allows student and professional artists to thrive.
What opportunities are available to support the event?
Click below to learn more about each opportunity to support the arts in our community!
Tickets will be available in September.

MENU CLOSE

More than forty years ago, our founders saw an opportunity to shape and grow the arts community. They had the foresight to envision Martin County as a vibrant region where residents and visitors alike could enjoy an arts friendly community. Decades later these ideas have blossomed and MartinArts supports student and professional artists involved in the visual, performing, literary and culinary arts. We seek to inspire audiences of all ages and backgrounds. Housed in the historic Court House Cultural Center, MartinArts offers an array of in-person and virtual experiences, web-based resources, and off-site programs.
The future of MartinArts shines brightly. Those seeds planted years ago, have yielded a rich tapestry of arts organizations and venues to enjoy. Whether you are an artist, resident, or visitor to our region, we invite you to join in the fun. MartinArts, growing the arts together.

Women Supporting the Arts works to build a community of local philanthropists who inspire, educate, and encourage a strong arts and cultural environment in Martin County.
To provide grants for arts enhancement programs, projects, scholarships, and internships to adults and children of all cultural and economic backgrounds in Martin County.
To educate women about the arts and cultural needs of the community and provide learning opportunities for philanthropy.
To develop friendships, support and networking opportunities by working for a common goal.
Women Supporting the Arts was born in 2004, when there were no local funding sources to support the county’s artists and cultural projects. MartinArts embraced the vision of a women's giving circle and has continued to provide support through its 501(c)3 umbrella and administrative services. In a community where the annual economic impact of the arts is more than 31 million, our grants fill an important gap.
WSA makes modest grants to individual artists; students; local arts organizations, civic groups, and nonprofits; and occasional government agency programs. Grant amounts average about $1,400, and the range (to date) goes from a low of $150 to a high of $9,000. All decisions about grants and allocations are made by group consensus.
Join Women Supporting the Arts
Learn more about our Grant Process

As part of our ongoing commitment to inspire participation and passion for the arts, we're thrilled to announce our partnership with the North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM) which means new perks for our valued members!
All memberships $150+ now come with exclusive access to over
1,300 incredible venues, including museums, art galleries, botanical gardens, children's museums, and more.
Whether you're a long-time supporter or new to the fold, there's never been a better time to join and enjoy the arts as a MartinArts member!
See below for a list of participating NARM Institutions and let your journey through the arts begin!
Click here to join MartinArts today.

Call to Artists
Add your event to our Calls to Artists
(click titles/links below for more information)
ArtsFest Stuart 2026
Deadline to apply: October 1
Apply now on zapplication.org
MartinArts invites artists to apply to be an exhibitor at the 39th Annual ArtsFest Stuart on February 7 & 8 , 2026.  A hometown celebration of arts and culture, the 2-day event provides the area with exceptional fine art and fine craft exhibitors, culinary arts, hands-on activities for the family, and a variety of live musical and theatrical performances. Since its inception in 1988, ArtsFest has grown to become one of the most cherished and well-attended community events on the Treasure Coast. It draws arts patrons, collectors, residents, and visitors to the City of Stuart during Florida's busy winter season. The event has received consistent recognition as a Southeast Tourism Society "Top 20 Event" every year since 2016, further highlighting its significance and appeal.
Contact Jennifer at 772-287-6676 (x2) or email
artsfest@martinarts.org
- please mention “ArtsFest Stuart 2026” in the subject line of the email.
35th Annual All Florida Juried Art Show
Deadline to Apply: October 1
Apply now at Callforentry.org
A Juried Exhibition presented by MartinArts
MartinArts invites artists residing in Florida to participate in its 34th Annual All Florida Juried Art Show. Open to all Florida artists in all media.  Selected works will be exhibited at the Court House Cultural Center from  January 9 through February 28, 2026.
Awards - First $500, Second $200, Third $100 and up to four Honorable Mentions $50.
Questions?? Contact Jennifer at 772-287-6676 (x2) or email
juriedshow@martinarts.org
- please mention “All Florida Juried Art Show” in the subject line of the email.
Marvin S. Cone Annual High School Juried Art Show Alumni Exhibit
Celebrating 40 Years of Creativity and Talent!
Get ready to celebrate an incredible milestone! In 2026, MartinArts is thrilled to host the 40th Anniversary of the Marvin S. Cone Annual High School Juried Art Show. From its humble beginnings in 1987 to becoming a beloved tradition, this show has showcased the phenomenal talent of our local high school artists. Now, it's time to reunite and shine a spotlight on the amazing alumni who helped make this journey so memorable!
We are calling all past participants - whether you’re rocking the art world professionally or keeping the creative spark alive through your hobbies, we want YOU to be part of this special Alumni Show. From painting and sculpture to photography, tattoo art, book illustration, and beyond – if you’re creating, we want to see it!
Don’t miss this chance to share your journey and showcase how your talent has evolved. If you're interested in being a part of this extraordinary event, submit your details today!
Contact Jennifer at 772-287-6676 (x2) or by email at
jhearn@MartinArts.org
and mention “Alumni Exhibit” in the subject line of the email.
Martin Murals Program
Part of the mission of the Martin County Art in Public Places program (AIPP) is to create a high-quality public realm in a manner that is visible and accessible to the public. The Martin Murals program is the vehicle that can inspire artists to design and paint murals on public and private properties throughout Martin County. The National Endowment for the Arts says it best “Creative placemaking animates public and private spaces, rejuvenates structures and streetscapes, improves local business viability and public safety, and brings diverse people together to celebrate, inspire, and be inspired.” Public art is also tied to positive tourism goals, instills a sense of civic pride, boosts economic growth, and inspires investment in our community.
To encourage public/private partnerships, the maximum funding amount through AIPP is $7,500 per project.
Questions?
Contact Martin County Art in Public Places Program  Office of Community Development 2401 SE Monterey Road Stuart, FL 34996 | (772) 419-6951
South Florida Cultural Consortium Grant Program
Deadline to Apply: October 6, 2025, 11:59PM
Maximum Awards: $7,500 / $15,000
The South Florida Cultural Consortium Grant Program offers one of the largest regional, government-sponsored artists' grants in the United States, awarding $15,000 and $7,500 grants to resident visual and media artists from the counties of Broward, Martin, Miami-Dade, Monroe, and Palm Beach. Since it was established in 1988, the Consortium has awarded over to $4 million in grants to over 300 artists. In addition to receiving the grant, the artists take part in an exhibition hosted and organized by a visual arts institution in one of the five counties, and since 2019, artworks by Miami-Dade based artists are acquired and accessioned for the Art in Public Places Collection.
Contact: Amanda Sanfilippo | (305) 375-5436 |
amandas@miamidade.gov
Florida Division of Arts & Culture
Looking for additional opportunities to showcase your art?  Check the Florida Division of Arts & Culture for listings for calls to artists, public art, competitions, residencies, job openings, and funding.
South Arts
Applications are now open for Individual Artist Career Opportunity Grants, Jazz Road Tours, and Accessibility Grants through September 3! Visit southarts.org or the link in our bio for details about these and other opportunities!
First Friday Art Walk at Frazier Creek Brewing & Distilling
Deadline: Ongoing-monthly
We’re excited to invite you to be a part of The Creek District & Frazier Creek Brewing & Distilling’s First Friday Art Walk, a monthly celebration of creativity, craft, and community in Downtown Stuart!
Every First Friday from 5PM–9PM, we showcase a featured artist—and we’re now opening up space for local makers too! This is a great opportunity to connect with fellow creatives, showcase your work, and meet new customers in a lively, welcoming venue.
>You keep 100% of your sales
>Marketing support with a custom co-branded image (just send us your high-res logo!)
We simply ask that you help spread the word and invite your audience to come support your work by sharing the event on all of your marketing and social media platforms.
If you're interested and available, please contact Katey Bourgeois (
Katey@FrazierCreekStuartFLA.com
) to complete the online form and select your preferred dates for participation. We'll follow up to confirm your spot as soon as possible.
Artist-in-Residence Program
Deadline to apply:
Varies
Atlantic Center for the Arts is now accepting applications for the Master Artists-in-Residence Program. Spend three weeks developing your work with the personal support and mentorship of internationally renowned Masters in visual arts, music composition, literature, and choreography. Participation is limited to 8 people for each Master Artist.
Helping People Succeed presents  'Working Wednesdays'
Did you know that we run an Adult Day Training program at our Jensen Beach office every day for adults with disabilities in our community?  You can give back by sharing your time and talent with them!  They'd love to hear and learn from you!  Sign up here to join us on a Working Wednesday to share a hobby, skill, job or passion with our clients!  They will love it!
Our team will contact you to provide more information, answer any questions you have, and schedule you to join us on a Wednesday convenient for you!
Questions: Email Shannon Wilson
swilson@hpsfl.org
or contact by phone 772.320.0832
A.E. Backus Museum & Gallery’s annual "The Best of the Best"
The A.E. Backus Museum & Gallery’s annual juried art exhibition, The Best of the Best, is accepting artist applications by advance appointments on Wednesdays–Sundays until 3:00 pm, beginning September 3 through September 26, 2025. The application is open to amateur and professional artists with a $30 entry fee per work. A full Prospectus with guidelines and application form is available to download from the Museum’s website.
Artists may enter their original work in The Best of the Best by submitting into one of four media categories. Each year the independent jury panel is an invited group of arts professionals who judge the entries based on artistic merit, exceptional quality and craftsmanship, creative success, and exemplary presentation. Accepted works of art will contend for cash prizes and placement honors (1st-2nd-3rd awards) in each category, with an overall Best of Show award. Additionally, at the end of the exhibition, visitor votes are counted for a special People's Choice award
Technical Questions? Please contact before entering and we'll try to help. Email at
info@BackusMuseum.org
or call (772) 465-0630.​
Big & Bold 2 - Artists of Palm Beach County
Deadline to Apply: August 31
Building on the success of Big & Bold 1, Artists of Palm Beach County is excited to partner for the second time with Car Team USA in Stuart to present the Big & Bold 2 exhibition, showcasing the combined talents of Palm Beach County and Treasure Coast artists in a new environment. The CarTeam USA venue is “industrial chic” with high ceilings, concrete walls, and pristine white tile floors – a dream for artists who paint Big & Bold. We encourage artists to submit three works sized 30” x 24” to 96” x 120” (with a minimum size of 30” x 24”). We will also accept some 3-D works no larger than 3 ft by 3 ft. Pedestals for 3-D work must be supplied by the artist and approved by APBC. All work must be for sale.
2026 Arts4All Florida Calendar Project
Submission Deadline: August 8, 2025, 5PM
Arts4All Florida invites Florida’s artists with disabilities, ages 18 and up, to submit a visual piece of art for our Call for Calendar Art. Selected images of artwork will be featured in the Arts4All Florida 2026 Calendar.
Thirteen images will be selected and featured in the twelve-month calendar (plus cover). The calendar will be distributed throughout Florida by Arts4All Florida. All questions can be sent to
mboye@usf.edu
Join the Indian River Pops Orchestra!
The Indian River Pops Orchestra is looking for talented musicians to join our vibrant community! We currently have openings for the following instruments: Violin, Viola, Cello, Bass, Bassoon
As a volunteer ensemble, we are passionate about sharing the joy of live music while providing opportunities for lifelong learning and performance. Our musicians range from young students to seasoned adults, with most residing in Martin County. We perform 6-7 concerts per season and often form smaller ensembles—such as brass and woodwind quintets or string groups—for additional performances.
Rehearsals for the next season begin in early September. Interested? Send us an email for more information or to attend a rehearsal. If you know someone who might be interested, please share this invitation!
Rehearsals: Tuesdays, 6:30 – 8:30 PM (September – May)
Location: Ross Hall/Pittenger Center, St. Mary’s Church, SE Ocean Blvd, Stuart, FL
Conductors: Michael Robbins (Conductor) & Keith Sanz (Assistant Conductor)
Email:
irpopsorchestra@gmail.com
| Visit us at irpopsorchestra.org
Sing with the Treasure Coast Community Singers!
COME SING WITH US!  Our four distinct performing groups offer a place for everyone from kindergarten to senior citizens. The Community Chorus is open to everyone high school age and older, with no skills or experience required, just a love of singing! Chamber Singers is open to everyone interested, but does require the ability to read music and a commitment to work on more challenging music. The Youth Chorus is for young singers in grades K-4 and the Middle School Chorus is for singers in grades 5-8.
Concerts are performed from October to May with a separate registration for each of the six concert sessions.
TCCS begins their fourth session of the year on Monday, March 17. Registration begins at 5:30 in Fellowship Hall. In-person rehearsals are Mondays: 4:15-5:15pm for Youth & Middle School Choruses, 5:30-6:45pm for Chamber Singers, and 6:45-8:00pm for Community Singers at Trinity United Methodist Church in Jensen Beach.
Join our chorus family and support the growth of the arts on the Treasure Coast!
Questions? Contact us at
tccssecretary@gmail.com
or 772-224-8807.
The Barn Theatre - Season 55 Open Auditions
The Barn Theatre is a 501(c)(3) non-profit community theatre located in Stuart, FL. Auditions for Season 55 productions—including Beautiful: The Carole King Musical, Cabaret, Hairspray, Rock of Ages, Into the Woods, and a Rocky Horror Picture Show shadow cast—are open to the public, and no prior experience is necessary. The Barn works with non-equity, volunteer performers and also welcomes technical crew volunteers. Auditions may involve cold readings or prepared music depending on the production, and video submissions are accepted up to 24 hours before the posted audition date. For full audition details and show-specific info, visit the audition page on the Barn Theatre’s website or contact Artistic Director Bryan W. Childe at
bryanbarntheatre@yahoo.com
or call the box office at (772) 287-4884.
ACT Studio Theatre – Upcoming Auditions!
ACT Studio Theatre is a non-profit community theatre located in Stuart, FL, known for presenting powerful, thought-provoking productions in an intimate black box setting. Auditions are open to the public, and all roles are performed by volunteer, non-union actors. No prior experience is required, and ACT welcomes individuals interested in both on-stage and behind-the-scenes roles. Specific audition dates, show information, and submission guidelines for upcoming productions can be found on the ACT website under the Auditions section. For more details or to express interest, please visit
www.actstudiotheatre.com
and navigate to the “Auditions” tab.
The Pineapple Playhouse - Open Auditions
Want to be in a show? The Pineapple Playhouse always welcomes new talent on our stage. We hold Open Auditions for any interested volunteers in the Treasure Coast area. Whether you are brand new to acting or returning to the stage after a long absence, The Pineapple has a place for you. See upcoming auditions below. Contact the Box Office for more details. Audition Location*: 700 W Weatherbee Rd. Fort Pierce, FL 34982. *Unless noted in the audition notice, all auditions take place at the Pineapple Playhouse.
Miami-Dade AIPP - North Bay Village Hall and Safety Complex
REQUEST FOR QUALIFICATIONS DEADLINE:  Monday, September 21, 2025, 11:59PM
ELIGIBILITY: Open to professional visual artists based in the United States
BUDGET: $537,000.00
Miami-Dade County Department of Cultural Affairs through its Art in Public Places Program on behalf of North Bay Village request artist qualifications for public art commissions at the North Bay Village Hall and Safety Complex. The North Bay Village Hall & Safety Complex will house the Village Hall, including staff offices. Operations within the facility will include the Police Department, and Fire Station 27. It will also provide services to the North Bay Village community and businesses in both its internal and exterior communal spaces, such as parking spaces and EV charging. The facility will be an iconic civic building that serves as a gateway to the municipality. The architecture promotes openness and community while expressing a bold, recognizable identity. Inspired by the coastal environment, the ribbon-like façade reflects the natural rhythms and contours of barrier island life. A transparent mesh cladding shifts appearance throughout the day, symbolizing the Village’s values of transparency, honesty, and
responsive governance.
Questions? Contact Amanda Sanfilippo Long,
Curator & Artist Manager, Art in Public Places
Director, South Florida Cultural Consortium
Miami-Dade County Department of Cultural Affairs
111 NW 1st Street, Suite 625, Miami, FL 33128
305-375-5436 |
amanda.sanfilippo@miamidade.gov
2026 Stormwater Calendar Photo Contest
Deadline for submissions: September 1, 2025
The City of Stuart Public Works Department is pleased to announce the opening of its annual Stormwater Calendar Photo Contest for the 2026 edition. The contest invites students, amateurs, and professional photographers to submit original images that capture the beauty of the natural environment within the City of Stuart.
This year’s theme, “Creating a Healthier River, Day by Day,” encourages photographers to focus on the visual story of clean water, healthy habitats, and the connection between daily life and water quality in the St. Lucie River and surrounding waterways.
For additional information, contact Brittany Dobridnia in the City of Stuart Public Works Department at (772) 600-1259 or via email at
bdobridnia@stuartfl.gov
Día de los Muertos 2025
Deadline to Apply: Wednesday, October 1, 2025
LULA Lake Worth Arts and EmmanuelArt Designs is thrilled to invite artists to be part of a powerful, juried exhibition that brings the timeless spirit of Día de los Muertos to life. This year's theme — Marigolds, Memory, and Magic — calls on creatives to ignite the senses and honor the souls of those who came before us. From the golden glow of cempasuchil petals to the vibrancy of sugar skulls, glowing candles, and intricate ofrendas, we welcome artwork that celebrates transformation, connection, and cultural tradition. Let your imagination blur the lines between past and present — between grief and joy — and breathe life into remembrance through bold color, personal symbolism, and storytelling.
Questions? Contact: Curator, Emmanuel Gonzales –
emmanuelart@gmail.com
“40 Seasons of Beauty” Art Contest
Deadline to enter: Monday, September 1, 2025 by 4:00 PM.
In honor of Heathcote Botanical Gardens’ 40th Anniversary, we’re inviting local artists of all ages to showcase their creative vision in our “40 Seasons of Beauty” Art Contest. Whether you work in watercolor, photography, digital illustration, or mixed media, this is your chance to have your art featured on Heathcote’s commemorative merchandise, outdoor banners, and more throughout our 2026 celebration year!
Submit original, vibrant artwork that captures the spirit, wonder, and botanical brilliance of Heathcote. One talented artist will win $500 and the honor of having their work represent our 40th Anniversary campaign. Finalists and the winning piece will be unveiled at our “Under the Lights: Wine, Cheese & Chocolate” event on December 4, 2025.
All entries must be dropped off at Heathcote Botanical Gardens, Fort Pierce, FL by appointment.
To schedule your drop-off: Call (772) 464-4672 ext. 101
Armory Art Center's "9th Annual Creative Market" in West Palm Beach
Deadline: September 19, 2025
Our annual art festival is coming up on Saturday, November 8 and Sunday, November 9, 2025. Entering our 9th year, the Creative Market brings together 5,000 community members, visitors, and tourists each year. It's a fun and exciting way for people to engage in the visual arts. Thanks to community support, parking and admission are FREE. The event features 80-100 juried artists outside, 2 juried art exhibitions indoors, live music, art demonstrations, and campus tours of many of our 12 art studios while classes are in session, providing a unique opportunity for visitors to become familiar with the 100+ courses (700-900 classes/workshops) that we offer annually, plus a children and family art zone...all of which is FREE. Festival food and drinks are available plus there is a pop-up gift shop, so plenty of opportunities for people to purchase art for their home, office, or to give as gifts.
Here are the links to join in on the fun:
Event info:
https://armoryart.org/festival-call-artists/
Application for Market Artists (juried):
https://www.zapplication.org/event-info.php?ID=13643
Application for indoor juried exhibition, "Full Circle::
https://form.jotform.com/251615860077156
Innovate Grant for Visual Artist and P{photographers
Deadline to apply: Varies
Innovate Grant distributes (2) $1,800.00 grants each quarter, to one Visual Artist and one Photographer. In addition, (12) honorable mentions (6 in art and 6 in photo), will be featured on our website and join a growing community of vibrant and talented artists. Grant cycles are in the Winter, Spring, Summer, and Fall.
Winners will be featured on our website and will receive a one time unrestricted $1,800.00 grant. All applicants retain the right to the work they submit. Two (2) distributed each quarter, four (4) times a year. Honorable Mentions will be featured and promoted on our website. All applicants retain the right to the work they submit. Twelve (12) distributed, six (6) per category, each quarter, four (4) times a year.
For more information or to apply visit innovateartistgrants.org
City of Port St Lucie - Two Commissioned Sculpture Opportunities at Roundabouts
September 26, 2025
Event Description	Project Description
The City of Port St. Lucie is seeking up to two artists or artist team to conceptualize, fabricate, and install two newly-commissioned sculptures, one each for two newly-constructed roundabouts at Southwest Paar Drive and Southwest Darwin (“Paar/Darwin Siteˮ) Boulevard and the roundabout at Southwest Paar Drive and Southwest Savona Boulevard (“Paar/Savona Siteˮ). Construction is projected for completion in late 2026. In alignment with Port St. Lucieʼs public art plan, sculpture for both roundabouts should reflect the character of Port St. Lucie and enhance the Cityʼs visual landscape. Specific goals for sculpture at the new roundabouts include:
● Express Port St. Lucieʼs identity
● Offer a visually stimulating, transformative, and inspiring experience
● Enhance traffic and pedestrian safety
● Enliven the built environment
Each sculpture has been allocated a lump sum of $150,000 for the selected artist(s) scope of services. The budget for this project is inclusive of all costs associated with the project, including but not limited to: artist expenses/honorarium, administration, sub-consultants, travel/lodging, artwork fabrication (including materials, details and specifications), site prep (including but not limited to foundation construction, structural engineering, plinth building, etc.), artwork storage, transportation and installation, related permits, licenses, taxes and insurance. Any expenses that exceed the contracted amount will be the artistʼs responsibility.
Inquiries about the program or the project should be made by sending an email to: Anna Talarico, Public Art Coordinator,
anna@designinglocal.com

MENU CLOSE

Since 1980, MartinArts has been the driving force for arts and culture in Martin County. MartinArts is the umbrella over the Arts Council, the local arts agency, and the Arts Foundation for Martin County. Our shared mission is
to inspire participation and passion for the arts in our community.
Through our galleries, signature events (ArtsFest and the MartinArts Awards), educational programming for students, and public art initiatives,
we create opportunities that uplift artists, nourish the cultural scene and make the arts accessible for all.
By offering spaces for expression, connection, and creativity, MartinArts strengthens
the cultural heartbeat of Martin County as well as the social and economic fabric of our region.
Located in the Court House Cultural Center, Martin County’s historic courthouse, our downtown Stuart location welcomes all who seek to experience the transformational power of the arts.
MartinArts values and celebrates the unique qualities of persons with diverse backgrounds and cultures. It is believed that inclusiveness adds to the organizational excellence when tapping the skills, talents, and resources of people of diversity. MartinArts will actively promote respect for persons of different race, creed, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, disability, sexual orientation, education, economic position, and ancestry. MartinArts will uphold the fundamental directives of equality and access to the arts for all.
The Arts Council
The Arts Council Inc., DBA MartinArts, is a private, non-profit organization with a 501(c)3 status through the IRS. MartinArts is supported in part by the Florida Department of State, Division of Cultural Affairs, the Florida Council on Arts & Culture, the City of Stuart, Martin County Board of County Commissioners and private contributions.
Annual Report 24-25
Board of Directors
